page.title: 05WOODHAM WALTER HALL
page.content: Cutting a path we slid into the drained moat in the ruins of Woodham Walter Hall.Once this had been an impressive manor belonging to the Fitzwalter family.The surrounding lands have evidence of the park, warren,wilderness and fish ponds which provided sport and a full pantry. Earlier visitors before us included {Anne Boleyn,Elizabeth I and Mary Tudor Whilst at the Hall Mary had planned to flee from England.If she had succeeded our history might have been quite different The Hall was dismantled in 1700.Around 1830 the site housed the falconer's lodge and hawks'mews of the Lord Falconer of England.The Halls chapel was dilapidated so in 1562 a new Elizabethan Church was built closer to the village,one of only six in England. . { . }
